citations.narrative:
The facility has not performed rabies vaccinations on four adult dogs in the kennel in accordance with the schedule
approved by the Attending Veterinarian. The dogs that were not vaccinated for rabies are Ellie (microchip number 49599),
Star (microchip number 67567), Carly (microchip number 58317), and Petunia (microchip number 49500). Failure to
follow a written and Attending Veterinarian approved schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites and vaccinations
for contagious and deadly diseases can result in a delay of treatment and disease exposure to the dogs. Correct by
ensuring that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases and sampling and treatment of parasites and other
pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian is followed.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 15-July-2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has not performed rabies vaccinations on four adult dogs in the kennel in accordance with the schedule 
approved by the Attending Veterinarian. The dogs that were not vaccinated for rabies are Ellie (microchip number 49599), 
Star (microchip number 67567), Carly (microchip number 58317), and Petunia (microchip number 49500). Failure to 
follow a written and Attending Veterinarian approved schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites and vaccinations 
for contagious and deadly diseases can result in a delay of treatment and disease exposure to the dogs. Correct by 
ensuring that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases and sampling and treatment of parasites and other 
pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian is followed. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 15-July-2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
